jobs.title: Founding Account Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

Conversion is building the AI-native marketing automation platform for modern software companies. Today, marketing is stitched together from outdated software, enrichment tools, and disconnected workflows. Funnels are broken. Messaging is misaligned. Most teams are flying blind.

We’re fixing that. Conversion lets growth teams build and automate their entire go-to-market motion in one place. From acquisition to activation to retention, it’s all managed in a single interface: fast, personalized, and powered by AI.

We’ve raised over $28 million from top investors such as Abstract Ventures, True Ventures, and HOF Capital. We’re at $6M+ ARR, growing quickly, and powering go-to-market for 4000+ customers.

We’re a lean, high-performing team in San Francisco. If you’re excited about selling a creative, modern product with clear ROI and doing your best work alongside world-class teammates; we’d love to meet you.

  • Over $28M in funding

  • $0 to $6M ARR in under 12 months, 4000+ customers

  • Elite team from Airbnb, Palantir, Pinterest, IMC Trading, Shopify, Linkedin, Microsoft, and more

About the Role

Hey there! Neil here 👋, co-founder and CEO at Conversion. I believe we are building one of the strongest sales teams in the world. The goal is that in 5 years, people talk about the Conversion team the way people talk about the Rippling and Toast sales teams today. What do those teams have in common? Very strong, founder-led sales. I LOVE sales and will be in the weeds with you.

Conversion is in a unique position where all our leads are inbound from word of mouth / GTM-engineered inbound. Members of our growth teams focus 70+% of their days closing and are routinely closing $500k+/mo. Ultimately, I believe the greatest sellers in the world only have 3 common traits in common:

  • They love sales.

  • They know every nook and cranny of the product they are selling. Our job is equally as much to educate as it is to sell. I believe this can be taught but ultimately comes easiest to those very intellectually curious.

  • They work very hard. We work 6 days/week in person and are willing to travel to meet an client at any time.

Responsibilities

  • Own and close full-cycle deals across startups and mid-market accounts

  • Run high-quality demos that clearly show Conversion’s value

  • Prospect new leads and work qualified inbound opportunities

  • Collaborate with product and engineering to tailor solutions to prospect needs

  • Help shape sales collateral and early process, tools, and systems

  • Surface feedback from prospects to inform product and marketing


You Might Be a Great Fit If You

  • You believe in high-intensity, in-person teams and want to be surrounded by top talent pushing in the same direction

  • You have the range to shift from a cold call sprint to a strategic product feedback session without skipping a beat

  • You care deeply about your sales craft: writing crisp emails, running tight demos, and being the most prepared person in the room

  • You are looking for the kind of opportunity that turns an elite IC into a future CRO

Useful links

Website: https://conversion.ai/

Learn more about our company culture here: https://conversion.ai/careers

  • Check out out this Next Play article about our team! https://nextplayso.substack.com/p/how-a-big-pivot-helped-this-company

jobs.title: Founding Deployment Strategist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

Conversion is building the AI-native marketing automation platform for modern software companies. Today, marketing is stitched together from outdated software, enrichment tools, and disconnected workflows. Funnels are broken. Messaging is misaligned. Most teams are flying blind. Marketers deserve better.

We’re fixing that. Conversion lets growth teams build and automate their entire go-to-market motion in one place. From acquisition to activation to retention, it’s all managed in a single interface: fast, personalized, and powered by AI.

We’ve raised over $28 million from top firms such as Abstract Ventures, True Ventures, and HOF Capital. We’re at $5M+ ARR, growing quickly, and powering go-to-market for 4000+ customers.

We’re a lean, high-performing team in San Francisco. If you’re excited about building creative, modern, product-led marketing and doing your best work alongside world-class teammates; we’d love to meet you.

  • Over $28M in funding

  • $0 to $6M ARR in under 12 months, 4000+ customers

  • Elite team from Airbnb, Palantir, Pinterest, IMC Trading, Shopify, Linkedin, Microsoft, and more

About the Role

Hey there! James here 👋, co-founder at Conversion. Just wanted to share my thoughts on the perfect candidate we're looking for to be one our Founding Deployment Strategists.

So what exactly is a Deployment Strategist? At Conversion, they make sure enterprise AI deployments succeed. A $100k+ deal does not survive on a nice pitch or a self-serve onboarding flow. It survives if the customer sees value in the pilot.

This means embodying four core responsibilities:

  1. Sales enablement: Partnering with the sales team to help close deals and execute proof-of-concepts for enterprise customers.

  2. Customer migration: Orchestrating the transition from a customer’s existing marketing infrastructure onto Conversion, acting as the bridge between their teams and our engineers to ensure a smooth and successful implementation.

  3. Succeeding with Conversion: Helping advise marketing teams on how to use this powerful new tool to 10x their marketing efforts. AI is now just finding it's way into enterprises, and we need someone to help customers discover what's truly possible in a post-LLM world.

  4. Shaping product: Working closely with engineering and product to shape the product with the most valuable input of all: customer feedback

This role is in-person 5 days/week in San Francisco.

You Might Be a Good Fit If You

  • Thrive cross-functionally, working alongside engineering, growth, and product

  • Have studied or worked in software engineering, but found that interfacing with customers is much more exciting than writing code all day

You Might Be a Great Fit If You

  • Love helping customers, and gain fulfillment from seeing customers thrive and succeed with the products we build

Useful links

Website: https://conversion.ai/

Learn more about our company culture here: https://conversion.ai/careers

  • Check out out this Next Play article about our team! https://nextplayso.substack.com/p/how-a-big-pivot-helped-this-company

jobs.title: Growth
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

Conversion is building the AI-native marketing automation platform for modern software companies. Today, marketing is stitched together from outdated software, enrichment tools, and disconnected workflows. Funnels are broken. Messaging is misaligned. Most teams are flying blind.

We’re fixing that. Conversion lets growth teams build and automate their entire go-to-market motion in one place. From acquisition to activation to retention, it’s all managed in a single interface: fast, personalized, and powered by AI.

We’ve raised over $28 million from top firms such as Abstract Ventures, True Ventures, and HOF Capital. We’re at $5M+ ARR, growing quickly, and powering go-to-market for 4000+ customers.

We’re a lean, high-performing team in San Francisco. If you’re excited about building creative, modern, product-led marketing and doing your best work alongside world-class teammates; we’d love to meet you.

  • Over $28M in funding

  • $0 to $6M ARR in under 12 months, 4000+ customers

  • Elite team from Airbnb, Palantir, Pinterest, IMC Trading, Shopify, Linkedin, Microsoft, and more

About the Role

We’re hiring our early growth and creative content team to help shape how Conversion is positioned, explained, and adopted.

You’ll lead our content and storytelling strategy across web, video, product updates, and outbound. You’ll work closely with product, design, and growth to bring new features to life, turn user stories into campaigns, and show the world how Conversion works. You’ll use the product yourself every day and be the first to build, write about, and share what’s possible.

This role is in-person 5 days/week in San Francisco.

Responsibilities

  • Be Conversion’s voice across product launches, email updates, and social channels

  • Write landing pages, product updates, how-to guides, campaign briefs, and social content

  • Build in public: share product workflows, post demos, and craft use cases using our own platform

  • Partner with founders, product, and growth to define launch narratives and GTM plans

You Might Be a Good Fit If You

  • Have 2+ years of experience in product marketing, content marketing, or a creative growth role

  • Are creative-forward and fluent in Figma, Notion, and/or lightweight video tools

  • Love working cross-functionally with design, product, and growth teams

  • Are excited to use Conversion daily to power your own campaigns and marketing experiments

  • Thrive in an early-stage, fast-moving environment where you own your outcomes

  • Are a strong writer who can simplify technical ideas into clear, engaging language

You Might Be a Great Fit If You

  • Have experience scaling a marketing team at a high-growth startup, particularly in B2B, AI, and SaaS industries

  • Have used or marketed B2B SaaS tools and are opinionated on the ideal marketing SaaS stack for startups

  • Follow growth marketing leaders like Kyle Poyar or Emily Kramer, or growth tools like Clay

  • Have a personal portfolio with accessible projects

Useful links

Website: https://conversion.ai/

Learn more about our company culture here: https://conversion.ai/careers

  • Check out out this Next Play article about our team! https://nextplayso.substack.com/p/how-a-big-pivot-helped-this-company

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

Conversion is building the AI-native marketing automation platform for modern software companies. Today, marketing is stitched together from outdated software, enrichment tools, and disconnected workflows. Funnels are broken. Messaging is misaligned. Most teams are flying blind.

We’re fixing that. Conversion lets growth teams build and automate their entire go-to-market motion in one place. From acquisition to activation to retention, it’s all managed in a single interface: fast, personalized, and powered by AI.

We’ve raised over $28 million from top firms such as Abstract Ventures, True Ventures, and HOF Capital. We’re at $5M+ ARR, growing quickly, and powering go-to-market for 4000+ customers.

We’re a lean, high-performing team in San Francisco. If you’re excited about building creative, modern, product-led marketing and doing your best work alongside world-class teammates; we’d love to meet you.

  • Over $28M in funding

  • $0 to $6M ARR in under 12 months, 4000+ customers

  • Elite team from Airbnb, Palantir, Pinterest, IMC Trading, Shopify, Linkedin, Microsoft, and more

About the Role

Hey there! James here 👋, co-founder and CTO at Conversion. Just wanted to share my thoughts on the perfect candidate we're looking to join our engineering team.

First off, I want to stress the technical difficulty and scale of what we're building here at Conversion. The reason marketing automation platforms haven't seen a new player in decades is because building one is hard. Our platform needs to handle gigabytes of data syncs per customer with the utmost reliability, coordinate complex workflows that automate mission critical "go-to-market" processes, handle form submissions that directly generate revenue for customers, and serve high delivering emails to millions of our customer's recipients.

With that being said, here's what we're looking for in a backend software engineer to join our core team:

  • Product focused: There is quite a bit of features that go into a marketing automation platform, and so we're looking for folks that can own entire products and scope out, design, and build features end to end. We believe the best PMs are engineers who understand the pain point, since they can best evaluate both the benefit and the cost of building a feature.

    • P.S. if you prefer building the systems that power our infrastruture, check out our Platform Engineering role!

  • Love building for customers: We at Conversion are extremely close with customers- every customer gets their own Slack channel in our organization for faster communication, and we add every engineer to the channel to directly answer questions, fix bugs, and build features! You feel the urgency much more when you hear it directly from the end user.

  • Intellectually curious: Conversion engineers are group of bright-eyed and constantly curious individuals, who love debating database designs (or if we'd win in a fight against an ostrich) at lunchtime.

This role is in-person 5 days/week in San Francisco.

You Might Be a Good Fit If You

  • Have a few years of relevant industry experience building robust and reliable systems

  • Have a startup mindset - Scrappy, intelligent, and entrepreneurially minded individuals interested in joining a fast paced startup and looking for early ownership and growth

  • Have experience with our tech stack: Golang in the backend, a job queuing system with Kafka, PostgreSQL as our database and cloud hosting with GCP

You Might Be a Great Fit If You

  • Often on tech Twitter

  • Track record of side projects, apps, hackathons. Our engineers have built a live streaming security system for their parent's new house, a database from scratch, a better "Splitwise" app, and hosted our Minecraft server, all while at Conversion!

Useful links

Website: https://conversion.ai/

Learn more about our company culture here: https://conversion.ai/careers

  • Check out out this Next Play article about our team! https://nextplayso.substack.com/p/how-a-big-pivot-helped-this-company

  • Over $28M in funding

  • $0 to $6M ARR in under 12 months, 4000+ customers

  • Elite team from Airbnb, Palantir, Pinterest, IMC Trading, Shopify, Linkedin, Microsoft, and more

About the Role

Hey there! James here 👋, co-founder and CTO at Conversion. Just wanted to share my thoughts on the perfect candidate we're looking for to join our engineering team.

First off, I want to stress the technical difficulty and scale of what we're building here at Conversion. The reason marketing automation platforms haven't seen a new player in decades is because building one is hard. Our platform needs to handle gigabytes of data syncs per customer with the utmost reliability, coordinate complex workflows that automate mission critical "go-to-market" processes, handle form submissions that directly generate revenue for customers, and serve high delivering emails to millions of our customer's recipients.

With that being said, here's what we're looking for in a platform software engineer to join our core team:

  • Engineer multiplier: You know how in Candy Crush you can hit a 2x multiplier? We believe it's the same analogy for platform engineering: your customers are our product engineers, and the goal is to unlock and empower them to build features to serve our customers best.

  • Intellectually curious: Conversion engineers are group of bright-eyed and constantly curious individuals, who love debating database designs (or if we'd win in a fight against an ostrich) at lunchtime.

  • Pragmatic optimizer: Over optimizing is a real thing. As a startup, our goal is to grow and build an amazing product that delivers value, not to needlessly upgrade our tech stack for the sake of doing so. Your job is to strike the fine line between the cost of implementing infrastructural changes vs. the potential benefits. Everything's a tradeoff, we want to take the worthwhile ones.

This role is in-person 5 days/week in San Francisco.

You Might Be a Good Fit If You

  • Have experience building out cloud infrastructure, dev-ops, and platform features at other fast growing companies

  • Have experience with our tech stack: Golang in the backend, a job queuing system with Kafka, PostgreSQL as our database and cloud hosting with GCP

You Might Be a Great Fit If You

  • Developer tooling fascinates you

  • Track record of side projects, apps, hackathons. Our engineers have built a live streaming security system for their parent's new house, a database from scratch, a better "Splitwise" app, and hosted our Minecraft server, all while at Conversion!

Our platform needs to handle gigabytes of data syncs per customer with the utmost reliability, coordinate complex workflows that automate mission critical "go-to-market" processes, handle form submissions that directly generate revenue for customers, and serve high delivering emails to millions of our customer's recipients.

With that being said, here's what we're looking for in a platform software engineer to join our core team:

 - Engineer multiplier: You know how in Candy Crush you can hit a 2x multiplier? We believe it's the same analogy for platform engineering: your customers are our product engineers, and the goal is to unlock and empower them to build features to serve our customers best.

 - Intellectually curious: Conversion engineers are group of bright-eyed and constantly curious individuals, who love debating database designs (or if we'd win in a fight against an ostrich) at lunchtime.

 - Pragmatic optimizer: Over optimizing is a real thing. As a startup, our goal is to grow and build an amazing product that delivers value, not to needlessly upgrade our tech stack for the sake of doing so. Your job is to strike the fine line between the cost of implementing infrastructural changes vs. the potential benefits. Everything's a tradeoff, we want to take the worthwhile ones.

This role is in-person 5 days/week in San Francisco.


YOU MIGHT BE A GOOD FIT IF YOU

 - Have experience building out cloud infrastructure, dev-ops, and platform features at other fast growing companies

 - Have experience with our tech stack: Golang in the backend, a job queuing system with Kafka, PostgreSQL as our database and cloud hosting with GCP


YOU MIGHT BE A GREAT FIT IF YOU

 - Developer tooling fascinates you

 - Track record of side projects, apps, hackathons. Our engineers have built a live streaming security system for their parent's new house, a database from scratch, a better "Splitwise" app, and hosted our Minecraft server, all while at Conversion!

jobs.title: Founding Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

Conversion is building the AI-native marketing automation platform for modern software companies. Today, marketing is stitched together from outdated software, enrichment tools, and disconnected workflows. Funnels are broken. Messaging is misaligned. Most teams are flying blind.

We’re fixing that. Conversion lets growth teams build and automate their entire go-to-market motion in one place. From acquisition to activation to retention, it’s all managed in a single interface: fast, personalized, and powered by AI.

We’ve raised over $28 million from top firms such as Abstract Ventures, True Ventures, and HOF Capital. We’re at $5M+ ARR, growing quickly, and powering go-to-market for 4000+ customers.

We’re a lean, high-performing team in San Francisco. If you’re excited about building creative, modern, product-led marketing and doing your best work alongside world-class teammates; we’d love to meet you.

  • Over $28M in funding

  • $0 to $6M ARR in under 12 months, 4000+ customers

  • Elite team from Airbnb, Palantir, Pinterest, IMC Trading, Shopify, Linkedin, Microsoft, and more

About the Role

Hey there! 👋 Kyle here — Head of Product at Conversion. This is a special role to me, as I started here as a product designer, and Levi and I currently own every design decision at Conversion, from design systems to interaction patterns to sock designs. It's a hard role for me to relinquish, but one I'm really excited to fill and bring on some more amazing design talent.

We work in a very competitive space with legacy incumbents (HubSpot, Salesforce, Adobe), which means design and user interactions carry a large weight in convincing customers to ditch incumbent software for a small startup. We care very deeply about craft because we already have to show we are reputable, intentional, elegant software. And having an email designer that is used by design and content teams only is icing on the cake.

With that being said, here's what we are looking for in our first designer:

  • High visual design craft and taste. We have an established design system and component library. Arranging those pieces is easy, but working on finer interactions, building in moments of delight, and being opinionated about those decisions is much harder. Someone who can flex (and is excited!) about doing some visual work when needed — LinkedIn banners, company merch, etc. — is a bonus.

  • A strong understanding of our product. I don't need a PM, but I need someone who will use our tool and have an opinion on how and what to craft. All of our engineers and designers are very opinionated from day one.

  • Figma-fluent. Auto Layout for almost everything. Usually doesn't name their layers.

  • Willing to experiment with AI tooling. I use v0 for all prototyping, and we are working on getting our own component library into prototyping tools. Folks who know when to press for the details and when to focus on the big picture possess a crucial skill here!

This role is in-person 5 days/week in San Francisco.


Responsibilities

  • Own end-to-end product design across web app, email editor, and marketing surfaces

  • Contribute to and evolve our design system and component library

  • Partner closely with engineering and product to ship high-quality features

  • Prototype ideas quickly using Figma, AI tools, or whatever gets the point across

  • Weigh in on product strategy and influence what we build, not just how it looks

  • Pitch in on brand moments like LinkedIn banners, merch, and visual storytelling

You Might Be a Good Fit If You

  • Have 2+ years of product design experience, ideally at a fast-moving startup

  • Are confident working within and evolving an existing design system

  • Have strong visual design taste and care about the little details

  • Are very Figma-fluent

  • Are excited to try new AI tooling and fast prototyping approaches

  • Love collaborating across product, engineering, and growth

You Might Be a Great Fit If You

  • You have a long list of designers you follow on Twitter

  • Save a notes folder or notion doc with your favorite portfolio/websites

  • Have purchased perplexity.supply merch

  • Have experience animating with Lottie, Rive, or After Effects

Useful links

Website: https://conversion.ai/

Learn more about our company culture here: https://conversion.ai/careers

  • Check out out this Next Play article about our team! https://nextplayso.substack.com/p/how-a-big-pivot-helped-this-company
